-1.question: who is the most paid player in the nba
-1.output: LeBron James remains the highest-paid player in the NBA entering the 2022-23 season, with an estimated total earnings of $124.5 million according to Forbes[17]. When accounting for all of his financial interests, James will bring in $111.2 million, putting him ahead of Stephen Curry ($92.8 million), Kevin Durant ($87.9 million), and Giannis Antetokounmpo ($80.3 million)[12]. The NBA announced in August that the salary cap has been set at $112.414 million for the 2021-22 season[14].
-1.context:
Passage 1:
S1: Stephen Curry isn't just known for cashing out from well beyond the 3-point line.
S2: The Warriors star once again finds himself on top of the list of the NBA's highest-paid players.
S3: Curry is set to make nearly $46 million in the final year of his current deal, but the money train will just keep on rolling.
S4: He signed an extension this past summer that will kick in at the start of the 2022-23 season and is worth a total of $215 million over four years.
S5: 0:00
S6: Former Rockets teammates James Harden and John Wall aren't far behind Curry at $44.3 million, and Russell Westbrook and Kevin Durant round out the top five.
S7: LeBron James lands at No. 6 overall, but he owns the title of highest earner in NBA history.
S8: He will eclipse $400 million in total salary by the end of his current Lakers contract.
S9: Who else is making the big bucks?
S10: Check out the full breakdown below.
S11: James is sitting behind a few players based on his NBA salary, but when you factor in his off-court earnings, he stands alone.
S12: The four-time MVP will bring in $111.2 million when accounting for all of his financial interests, according to Forbes , putting him ahead of Curry ($92.8 million), Durant ($87.9 million), Giannis Antetokounmpo ($80.3 million) and Westbrook ($74.2 million).
S13: The list of the 15 highest-paid players in NBA history features eight current players who are still adding to their totals, including Suns star Chris Paul, who will hit more than $300 million in career earnings this season.
S14: The NBA announced in August that the salary cap has been set at $112.414 million for the 2021-22 season, an approximately three percent jump from the previous campaign.
S15: The luxury tax level is $136.606 million, and the minimum team salary is $101.173 million.

Passage 2:
S16: LeBron James remains the highest-paid player in the NBA entering the 2022-23 season.
S17: The 37-year-old Los Angeles Lakers star claimed the top spot on Forbes ' annual list of the league's highest-paid players for the ninth straight year, bringing in an estimated $124.5 million in total earnings.
S18: He'll earn $44.5 million in on-court salary and another $80 million off the court.
S19: James is just the fifth athlete in a team sport to surpass $100 million in pretax earnings in one year, joining soccer stars Lionel Messi , Cristiano Ronaldo , and Neymar , along with Dallas Cowboys quarterback Dak Prescott , according to Forbes.
S20: Golden State Warriors star Stephen Curry is second on the NBA list at $95.1 million, including a league-high salary of $48.1 million.
S21: Rounding out the top five are the Brooklyn Nets ' Kevin Durant ($88 million), the Milwaukee Bucks ' Giannis Antetokounmpo ($86.5 million), and the Lakers' Russell Westbrook ($82.1 million).
S22: The NBA's 10 highest-paid players are expected to take home a collective $751 million before taxes and agents' fees, an increase of 5% from last year's record amount of $714 million and a 122% increase from a decade ago.
S23: Here's the complete top 10:
S24: |RANK||PLAYER||TOTAL EARNINGS||SALARY||ENDORSEMENTS|
S25: |1.||LeBron James||$124.5M||$44.5M||$80M|
S26: |2.||Stephen Curry||$95.1M||$48.1M||$47M|

S28: |4.||Giannis Antetokounmpo||$86.5M||$42.5M||$44M|
S29: |5.||Russell Westbrook||$82.1M||$47.1M||$35M|
S30: |6.||Klay Thompson||$60.6M||$40.6M||$20M|
S31: |7.||Damian Lillard||$60.5M||$42.5M||$18M|
S32: |8.||James Harden||$53M||$33M||$20M|
S33: |9.||Paul George||$51M||$42.5M||$8.5M|
S34: |10.||Jimmy Butler||$49.7M||$37.7M||$12M|
